51-year-old.context: This is a 51-year-old gentleman here with his wife.

obstructive sleep apnea syndrome.context: Preoperative Diagnosis: Obstructive sleep apnea syndrome with hypertrophy of tonsils and of uvula and soft palate.

hypertrophy of tonsils.context: Preoperative Diagnosis: Obstructive sleep apnea syndrome with hypertrophy of tonsils and of uvula and soft palate.

hypertrophy of uvula.context: Preoperative Diagnosis: Obstructive sleep apnea syndrome with hypertrophy of tonsils and of uvula and soft palate.

hypertrophy of soft palate.context: Preoperative Diagnosis: Obstructive sleep apnea syndrome with hypertrophy of tonsils and of uvula and soft palate.

deviation of nasal septum.context: Postoperative Diagnosis: Obstructive sleep apnea syndrome with hypertrophy of tonsils and of uvula and soft palate with deviation of nasal septum.

loud snoring.context: She confirms the history of loud snoring at night with witnessed apnea.

apnea.context: She confirms the history of loud snoring at night with witnessed apnea.

moderate sleep apnea.context: This showed moderate sleep apnea with significant desaturation.

significant desaturation.context: This showed moderate sleep apnea with significant desaturation.

CPAP.context: The patient was unable to tolerate treatment with CPAP.

large tonsils.context: At the office, we observed large tonsils and elongation and thickening of the uvula as well as redundant soft tissue of the palate.

elongation of uvula.context: At the office, we observed large tonsils and elongation and thickening of the uvula as well as redundant soft tissue of the palate.

thickening of uvula.context: At the office, we observed large tonsils and elongation and thickening of the uvula as well as redundant soft tissue of the palate.

redundant soft tissue of palate.context: At the office, we observed large tonsils and elongation and thickening of the uvula as well as redundant soft tissue of the palate.

tortuous appearance of septum.context: A tortuous appearance of the septum also was observed.

tonsillectomy with electrodissection tec.context: The tonsils were first removed using electrodissection technique.

hemostasis with electrocautery and sutur.context: Hemostasis was achieved with the electrocautery and with sutures of 0 plain catgut.

injection of tonsil fossae with Marcaine.context: The tonsil fossae were injected with 0.25% Marcaine with 1:200,000 epinephrine.

resection of uvula and soft palate.context: The planned anterior soft palate incision was marked out with the electrocautery from the left anterior tonsillar pillar rising upwards and then extending horizontally across the soft palate to include all of the uvula and a portion of the soft palate, and the incision then extended across the midline and then inferiorly to meet the right anterior tonsillar pillar.

closure of soft palate wound.context: Closure of the soft palate wound was then accomplished with interrupted 3-0 chromic catgut sutures.

septoplasty with Cottle elevator.context: Mucoperichondrium and mucoperiosteum were elevated with the Cottle elevator.

resection of deflected portion of septal.context: The right-sided mucoperiosteum was elevated with the Freer elevator and then with Takahashi forceps and with the 4 mm osteotome, the deflected portion of the septal bone from the vomer was resected.

closure of nasal septal mucosal flaps.context: The nasal septal mucosal flaps were then sutured together with a quilting suture of 4-0 plain catgut.

outfracture of inferior turbinates.context: The inferior turbinates were then both outfractured using a knife handle.

irrigation of nose and throat.context: The nose and throat were irrigated with saline and suctioned.

placement of orogastric tube.context: An orogastric tube was placed and a moderate amount of clear fluid suctioned from the stomach and this tube was removed.

sponge and needle count.context: Sponge and needle count were reported correct.

estimated blood loss.context: Estimated blood loss was about 15-20 cc.
